question: 抱擁
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>embrace</kanji> and a <kanji>hug</kanji> are pretty much the same thing. So you're still going to <vocabulary>embrace</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>hug</vocabulary> people!
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You didn't learn this reading for <ja>抱</ja> yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

Who gives the best <vocabulary>hug</vocabulary>s in the world? Harry <reading>Hou</reading>dini (<ja>ほう</ja>)! He knows what it's like to be hugged too tightly because he's always in straight jackets. So his hugs are nice and gentle. Just the way you like them!
